wiki.content:
Just Push Play is the thirteenth studio album by American hard rock band Aerosmith, released in 2001 (see 2001 in music). Helping Aerosmith in the studio were coproducers and song collaborators Marti Frederiksen and Mark Hudson.
 
 Just Push Play features the same slick pop production that Aerosmith had been using in recent albums, though this time there was more of a vintage-era edge to most of the tracks.
 
 The album's first single, "Jaded", became a major Top 10 hit in the U.S. and around the world. As a result, Just Push Play was certified platinum within a month of its release. Subsequent singles "Fly Away from Here", "Sunshine", and "Just Push Play", though garnering some airplay, failed to impact the Hot 100 much, although the latter two charted on the U.S. Mainstream Rock chart and the former charted on the Adult Top 40.
 
 The eight-month long Just Push Play Tour, which ran from June 2001 to January 2002 was launched to support the album.
 
 The album's cover features a gynoid resembling Marilyn Monroe and was designed by Hajime Sorayama. As a pun of the album name, Guitar Hero: Aerosmith uses the album's cover on the start screen and states over it "Just push any button to play". The cover is similar to American rock band Autograph's album That's the Stuff because they both have gynoids on the cover.
 
 Track listing
 # Title Music Length 
 1. "Beyond Beautiful"   Steven Tyler, Joe Perry, Marti Frederiksen, Mark Hudson 4:45 
 2. "Just Push Play"   Tyler, Hudson, Steve Dudas 3:51 
 3. "Jaded"   Tyler, Fredriksen 3:34 
 4. "Fly Away from Here"   Fredriksen, Todd Chapman 5:01 
 5. "Trip Hoppin'"   Tyler, Perry, Fredriksen, Hudson 4:27 
 6. "Sunshine"   Tyler, Perry, Fredriksen 3:37 
 7. "Under My Skin"   Tyler, Perry, Fredriksen, Hudson 3:45 
 8. "Luv Lies"   Tyler, Perry, Fredriksen, Hudson 4:26 
 9. "Outta Your Head"   Tyler, Perry, Fredriksen 3:22 
 10. "Drop Dead Gorgeous"   Tyler, Perry, Hudson 3:42 
 11. "Light Inside"   Tyler, Perry, Fredriksen 3:34 
 12. "Avant Garden"   Tyler, Perry, Fredriksen, Hudson 4:52 
 
 Roughly 45 seconds after "Avant Garden" a hidden track entitled "Under My Skin Reprise" plays for about one minute. 
 
 Bonus track and video (International version)
 A bonus track and video was included on limited edition North American releases exclusive to Best Buy.
 
 # Title Music Length 
 13. "Face"   Tyler, Perry, Fredriksen 4:25 
 14. "Jaded" (video)   3:47 
 
 
 Bonus tracks (Japanese version)
 # Title Length 
 13. "Won't Let You Down"     
 14. "I Don't Want to Miss a Thing"     
 
 
  Disc 2 (Japanese limited edition)
 "Just Push Play" [Radio Remix] - 3:17 
 "Same Old Song and Dance" [Live from California Jam II '78] - 5:14 
 "Draw the Line" [Live from California Jam II '78] - 4:32 
 "Chip Away the Stone" [Live from California Jam II '78] - 4:24 
 "Big Ten Inch Record" [Live from Texxas Jam '78] - 3:59 
 "Lord of the Thighs" [Live from Texxas Jam '78] - 7:14 
 
 Personnel
 Tom Hamilton - bass 
 Joey Kramer - drums 
 Joe Perry - guitar, Background vocals 
 Steven Tyler - lead vocals, harmonica, percussion, piano, squeezebox, additional guitar, drums 
 Brad Whitford - guitar 
 
 Additional personnel
 Paul Caruso - loop programming 
 Jim Cox - piano 
 Dan Higgins - clarinet, saxophone 
 Tony Perry - guitar, scratching, pedal steel, vocals, background vocals, hurdygurdy, slide guitar 
 Paul Santo - Hammond organ, Kurzweil synthesizer 
 Tower of Power - horn 
 Liv Tyler - whisper 
 Chelsea Tyler - Backing vocals (Under My Skin) 
 
 Production
 Producers: Marti Frederiksen, Mark Hudson, Joe Perry, Steven Tyler 
 Engineers: Brian Carrigan, Paul Caruso, Richard Chycki, Marti Frederiksen, Scott Gordon, Jesse Henderson, Paul Santo, Allen Sides 
 Assistant engineer: Fran Flannery 
 Mixing: Mike Shipley 
 Mastering: George Marino 
 Recording: Richard Chycki, Marti Frederiksen 
 Instrument technician: Jim Survis 
 Loop programming: Paul Caruso 
 Horn arrangements: Jim Cox 
 String arrangements: David Campbell, Jim Cox 
 Special projects coordinator: Keith Garde 
 Author: Stephen Saper 
 Art direction: Kevin Reagan 
 Design: Kevin Reagan 
 Make-up: Melissa Rogers 
 
 [edit] Charts
 
 Album
 Billboard (North America)
 
 Year Chart Position 
 2001 The Billboard 200 2 
 2001 Top Canadian Albums 2 
 2001 Top Internet Albums 2 
 
 
 Singles
 Billboard (North America)
 
 Year Single Chart Position 
 2001 "Fly Away from Here" Adult Top 40 36 
 2001 "Fly Away from Here" Top 40 Mainstream 24 
 2001 "Fly Away from Here" Top 40 Tracks 34 
 2001 "Jaded" Adult Top 40 6 
 2001 "Jaded" Canadian Singles Chart 6 
 2001 "Jaded" Latin Pop Airplay 30 
 2001 "Jaded" Latin Tropical/Salsa Airplay 21 
 2001 "Jaded" Mainstream Rock Tracks 1 
 2001 "Jaded" The Billboard Hot 100 7 
 2001 "Jaded" Adult Top 40 Recurrents 6 
 2001 "Jaded" Top 40 Mainstream 6 
 2001 "Jaded" Top 40 Tracks 8 
 2001 "Just Push Play" Mainstream Rock Tracks 10

 Certifications
 Organization Level Date 
 RIAA - USA Gold April 3, 2001 
 RIAA - USA Platinum April 3, 2001 
 ABPD - Brazil Gold 2001 
 
 
 A promotional Just Push Play poster can be seen in Drake and Josh's room in the Teen Nick show "Drake and Josh". 
 Joe Perry provides lead vocals on the track "Drop Dead Gorgeous". 
 "Beyond Beautiful" is a playable song in Guitar Hero: Aerosmith. 
 A tribute to the title song of the album can be seen in the Disney's Hollywood Studios' attraction Rock 'n' Roller Coaster. In the limo loading area, there is a parking ticket dispenser that reads "Insert ticket and just push pay."

wiki.summary: Just Push Play is the thirteenth studio album by American hard rock band Aerosmith, released in 2001 (see 2001 in music). Helping Aerosmith in the studio were coproducers and song collaborators Marti Frederiksen and Mark Hudson.  Just Push Play features the same slick pop production that Aerosmith had been using in recent albums, though this time there was more of a vintage-era edge to most of the tracks.
